content: I think it might be a good idea to add a GitHub label for error explanations (e.g., rustc --explain E0607). Something like A-error-explanations maybe?
And if someone in the rust-lang organization has time, perhaps change the description of A-diagnostics from Error messages to Errors, warnings, and lints or something like that?
I did A-explain but I can change it to A-error-codes, I like that better
Personally I think something that has explain in it is clearer because it's specific to the explanation
But either way, it can always be changed :smile:
yeah fortunately github makes it easy to change the name without having to relabel everything
"explain" seems somewhat more nebulous and error codes aren't specifically tagged separately from diagnostics.
well the error codes tell you to use --explain which is why I like it
"Oh Rust, please explain this to me" :)
I am not attached to anything in particular, I am just thinking about "if I knew nothing about the context of this label, would I know to NOT assign it to every A-diagnostics issue?"
and explaining my reasoning that A-error-codes defines a narrower and obvious set over A-diagnostics, which is already a big filtering improvement.
Hmm, well we have a label, which is satisfactory for me
@Joshua Nelson Thanks for changing the A-diagnostics description!
